title: Ticket #2193: Cron logic will re-exec non-existent job forever
description:
Similar to #2191 (discovered in testing fix to it), the Daemon Classad Hooks logic will attempt to re-run a job with an invalid executable (in particular, if Create_Process() fails for any reason) in a tight loop. This applies only to the first run of the job.

I've already coded up a fix, which Greg has reviewed.
check_ins: 2011-May-26 13:18   Check-in [21992]: Fixed a bug in which the startd can get stuck in a loop trying to execute an invalid Daemon ClassAd Hook job. #2193 ===VersionHistory=== Fixed a bug in which the startd can get stuck in a loop trying to execute an invalid (i.e. non-existent) Daemon ClassAd Hook job.
